pageContext.description: 2 rivets near end of hilt & 1 loose in hole near c. This is bent, probably in breaking. A strong mid-rib.
pageContext.surface: Caked carbonate on hilt. ? Pitted along blade (described in original as "a mass of points for ornament" "extending the full length withour any definite arrangement in lines")
pageContext.associations: Hoard of leaf shaped swords, spearheads, 1 dagger & some rings, also ferrules (53 articles in 63 fragments).
pageContext.publications: White's Selborne, Macmillan, 1876, Vol. II, pp. 254-258.,White's Selborn Bell, 1877, Vol. II, p. 381,Evans' A. B. Imps., p. 464
pageContext.site: England,Hampshire,Selborne,In the garden of a cottage on western side of road ascending from Eveley corner to Hogmoor.,Spring 1870
